clinical_study.brief_title: Fatty Acid Levels and Memory in Breastfed Children
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of FADS2 rs 174575 on Breastmilk Fatty Acid Levels and the Recognition Memory Abilities of 6-month Old Breastfed Infants and Follow-up

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose: To explore the relation between breastmilk nutrients and the cognitive abilities of breastfed infants.
Phase 1: Near 3 months of age child and mother saliva samples for DNA obtained with breast milk sample.
Phase 2: At 6 months of age child participates in electrophysiology session to test recognition memory.
Phase 3: At 26 or 38 months of age, children will complete behavioral, dietary, and physical assessments.

primary_outcome.measure: Relation between recognition memory and maternal FADS genotype
primary_outcome.description: At 6 months of age, during the second session (Phase 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Nutrient content of breastmilk as it relates to FADS genotype
secondary_outcome.description: Sample provided in session 1 when the infant was 3-4 months old (Phase 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Nutrient content of breastmilk as it relates to recognition memory
secondary_outcome.description: At 6 months of age, during the second session (Phase 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Relation between declarative memory and breastmilk nutrients
secondary_outcome.description: At session 3, when the child was either 26 or 38 months of age (Phase 3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Relation between declarative memory and concurrent nutrients
secondary_outcome.description: At session 3, when the child was either 26 or 38 months of age (Phase 3)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- typically-developing
- exclusively breastfed
- unremarkable delivery
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-English speaking
- history of seizure activity
